1.content: pick the star trek series
1.title: series selection

111.content:
Captain James T. Kirk didn't know what was going on.
One minute, he was talking to someone in a spaceship, the next, he was beamed onto a weird planet.
He was on a stage, and the audience seemed to consist of strange birdlike humanoids.
An Andorian in a poncho said, "And now it's time to play Let's Show How These Items Work". "Let's Show How These Items Work?" thought Kirk.
On the stage, there were several Starfleet items: a replicator, a tricorder, a phaser, a communicator, and a universal translator.
Which item does Kirk show the aliens how it works first?
111.title: Captain kirk

112.content: Where is Bones at the beginning?
112.title: Doctor Mcoy

choices: Try to speak to the alien.
113.content:
One day, Spock was investigating a cave and inside he saw what appeared to be a blob of jelly with a face. "Fascinating," he said.
What does Spock do now?
113.title: Spock

choices: Try and raise the baby as though he was a daddy.
Try and find out who the parents are.
114.content: One day, Scotty was working at the transporter and then a baby transported onto the transporter. What does he do now?
114.title: Montgomery scott "Scotty"

1151.content: Where was Sulu at the beginning of the story?
1151.title: Sulu

choices: Uhura reports the Tribble troubles to Captain Kirk.
Uhura and Scotty begin their own mission to eradicate Tribbles.
1152.content:
"Uhura, here. Captain Kirk has just left the com. Want to go grab some lunch?" Lt. Uhura speaks into the microphone. Across the room Scotty picks up the message and nods. When they're both relieved from their stations, they take the elevator down to the cafeteria.

Even on a ship as big as this, the cafeteria was planned with several theme areas. The crew members sit in the Jungle area. among the tropical plants while birds flit around hologram banana trees.

Uhura eats her burger created in the food-o-matic. She spots something on the ground need the holo-trees. "Scotty, what is that?" She points at a little fuzzy thing on the floor."

"Ya got me Missy." Scotty barely looked up from his steak to see what it was.

The fuzzball moved closer. Uhura peeped a tiny scream and lifted her feet under the table. "Scotty, I think it's alive."

That got Scotty's attention. "Aye, it looks to be some sort of rat."

"RAT?" Uhura was fully up on the chair now. "Rat?"

"Oh lassie, it's a tiny scrrrap of a thing. Nothing to worry your head about." He patted her hand.

The fuzz moved to Scotty and made a little purring noise. Uhura stepped down and examined it closer. "Oh I know what this is. We've had these on the ship before." She tossed it a scrap of food. "It's a Tribble."

"Great Scot woman! Not those blasted things! It took all of my reserve power to eradicate those. Catch it!"

Uhura and Scotty scramble between the chairs and tables trying to catch the elusive Tribble. They're finally forced to give up the chase as it disappears down an air vent.
1152.title: Trouble with Tribbles begins.

choices: Chekov and the googly-eyed boy form a friendship.
The googly-eyed boy puts Chekov into a weird trance.
The googly-eyed boy tells Chekov that he is in danger.
1153.content:
Chekov was sitting on his chair, looking out the Viewscreen.
He then noticed a ship in the distance. It looked unfamiliar.
"They're hailing us," said Uhura.
"Onscreen," said Kirk. What they saw was very strange. It appeared to be a human teenage boy, but his eyes were very peculiar and seemed to swivel around. Scotty beamed them in and he said: "I'd like to talk to Chekov." Chekov was surprised and they walked onto the holodeck together.
What happens now?
1153.title: Chekov

12.content: pick a character (TV series era)
12.title: TNG

choices: He asks Worf what's bothering him
He let's Worf simmer and walks down the ramp
121.content:
It is 0700 and Captain Picard is just finishing up his breakfast when his communicator chirps. He taps it.

"Picard!" he says.

"Captain! We've just received a distress call from the science station in the Gular system!" Riker's voice replies.

"Understood! I'm on my way!" replies Picard as he gets up and leaves his quarters.

When Picard gets to the bridge he finds Worf standing, facing him. Something seems to be troubling him. Does Picard ask Worf what is wrong?
121.title: A distress call

choices: "I recieved a message from the Homeworld!"
1211.content:
"Worf? Is there a problem?" asks Picard.

"No sir!" snaps Worf.

"You certain Lieutenant?" inquires Picard once more.

Worf is clearly uncomfortable discussing whatever it was on the bridge so Picard smiles, pats Worf on the shoulder and starts heading down the ramp to his command chair.

"We'll talk about it later Lieutenant!" Picard states before turning to face Riker, "Report!"

"We recieved a priority one distress call from the Gular science station! All we received was static! No understandable message at all!" announces Riker, his blue eyes filled with worry.

Picard looks around the bridge to see everyone's eyes turned on him.

"Set a course for the Gular system! Engage!" orders Picard, "Number one, you have the Bridge! Worf, In my ready room now!"

With that Riker tugs on his uniform and moves over to the command chair as Worf precedes Picard into his ready room. Inside the ready room Picard walks over to the replicator and orders some tea. He then turns around to see Worf standing at full atention. Picard then walks around his desk and sits down. he motions Worf to do the same. As he often does Worf refuses to sit down.

Picard sighs then says, "Mr. Worf, what seems to be the problem?"

Worf's reply is...
1211.title: A cold Reality

12111.content: "Mr. Worf, you are most certainly troubled by something. If it is going to interfere with your duties I need you to tell me now!” demanded Picard.
12111.title: Does Worf explain?

12112.content:
"Really, has K'mpec changed his mind?" asks Picard reffering to the recent series of events that occured on the Klingon Homeworld. (episode 165, Sins of the Father)

"No sir, he has not!" replies Worf, saddened by the memory of those same events, "However a family emergency has arisen and I may be forced to return to the homeworld shortly!"

Picard, remebering Worf's Brother Kurn, leans back, resting his teacup in his lap. "Is your brother ill?" inquires Picard.

"No sir! I'm afraid it's much worse! He is being blackmailed by Duras and requires assistance dealing with the matter," answers Worf.

"I see," returns Picard, "Well, as soon as this mission is complete you can take some time off to go and help your brother. However in the meantime we'll need you here."

"Understood sir!" announces Worf.

Just then Picard's communicator chirps again. When he taps it he is told by Riker that they've arrived in the Gular system.

At that Picard declares that he's on his way and leaves the ready room followed shortly afterwards by Worf.

(Now then, is the Gular Science Station an orbital facility or a land based one?)
12112.title: Worf's Problem

choices: sits down and orders them out of the system
121121.content:
Coming onto the bridge Picard looks at the main viewer and sees a large amount of debris floating lazily through space. in the background is the rust coloured planet of Gular II.

"What happened?" asks Picard as he walks towards the command chair.

"Unknown sir," replies Data, "Although we are picking up severe electromagnetic interference."

"The source?" asks Riker.

"Also unknown."

Picard stands there, fixated on the debris on the viewscreen. He then hears the turbolift doors open and close. Turning he sees Counselor Troi coming onto the bridge to stand beside Worf.

"What was the crew complement of the Science Station?" inquires Picard with renewed interest.

"Approximately One Hundred and twenty three," stated Data.

"That's awful!" announces Counsellor Troi, leaning on the railing in shock.

Picard then...
121121.title: An orbital disaster

1211211.content:
"Mr. Data, I want you to head up the investigation into what happened to the science station!" orders Picard.

"Understood sir. I'll begin at once." replies Data, getting up from his position at Operations and walking to the science station.

"In the meantime, you have the bridge Number One!" announced Picard as he walks into the Turbolift.

As the doors close behind Picard he turns around and thinks about where to go.

Picard makes up his mind and says, "Computer...
1211211.title: Into the turbolift

12112111.content: As Picard enter Ten Forward he looks around and sees that Guinan was not behaind the bar. This was unusual as it was getting to be nearly lunch time. In fact Ten Forward was completely empty. Realizing something was wrong Picard tapped his communicator but nothing happened. Picard then walked over to a console and tried to contact another part of the ship. When that didn't work he walked over to the windows and tried to find out what was going on. Then he saw the reflection of a bright flash in the windows. Turning around he saw...
12112111.title: A Vacant Lounge

choices: "I was having some pyrotechnic fun when you arrived"
"Demands Captain? And what if I refuse?"
121121111.content:
"Q!" groans Picard as he sees the egoistic superbeing floating in the air just above the bar.

"Hello mon capitaine!" says Q as he floats down onto the bar.

"What have you done this time Q?" demands Picard.

"Oh, nothing really. I just came to see how you were doing Jean Luc."

"I'm touched!" says Picard sarcastically.

"Now, now, now Captain. don't be so sarcastic. That doesn't suit you well!"

"I don't care Q. Now tell me why you are here. The truth this time!" demanded Picard.
121121111.title: Q arrives

choices: goes over to talk with Guinan
1211211111.content:
"You destroyed the station?" exclaims Picard, furious at Q.

"Oh no no my dear Captain! I arrived to late to play with your quaint little starbase. It is just that, well you know how it can get... Omnipotence can be quite boring unless you blow something up every once in a while," explains Q

"What did you blow up?" demands Picard.

"That, Captain, Is for me to know and you to find out," smirks Q, "Farewell mon Capitaine! I shall be watching you and your merry crew!"

With a flash of light, Q dissapeared and ten forward was suddenly filled with people.

Picard then...
1211211111.title: Q's little games

choices: "Oh, Picard, don't be so upset. Here, have a cigar!"
1211211112.content: "Q, you know very well there is nothing I can do to you. Aside from refusing to play your little games!" snaps Picard.
1211211112.title: Demands?

choices: A space lifeform attacked the science station
A Ferengi vessel attacked the science station
12112111121.content:
With a flash an already lit cigar appeared in Picard's hand. Q's clothes have now changed to resemble Fidel Castro's Uniform.

"Q! I am not amused!" says Picard.

"Alright Captain! How about now?" replies Q.

With another flash of light Picard finds himself seated on a huge pillow with scantily clad women massaging him and feeding him grapes. Meanwhile Q is dressed in a toga and playing the lyre.

"Q! Stop this foolishness at once!" shrieks Picard, standing up and brushing off his uniform.

"If you insist!" and with another flash of light Q, the women and the oversized pillow dissapear.

Picard then found himself standing in a nearly full Ten Forward still holding the cigar.

"Captain," says Data's voice over the intercom, "I have discovered what happened to the science station."

Picard nods his head, says that he'll be right there and goes to the turbolift. Later, in the briefing room Data is explaining that...
12112111121.title: Not Amused!

choices: Attempt to track the Ferengi vessel
Find out what Q has to do with this
121121111212.content:
"Analysis of the damaged hull fragments shows that Ferengi disruptor fire was the likely cause of the damage done to the station. However, this is inconsistent with our previous records regarding their strategies, as it was precisely targeted on the structural weakpoints of the station."
Picard stroked his chin in thought. "I encountered Q on the way to the briefing room. There's no telling if what we're dealing with is due to Q's meddling, but from this point on, anything could be possible."
121121111212.title: A Ferengi vessel attacked the science station

choices: Q makes the bridge staff disappear
Worf is so incenced that he ignores his orders and launches at Q
1211211112122.content:
"Mr Data, set up a continous scan for anything unusual or any sign of Q, I want to find out what he's up to" said Picard turning to speak to Riker

"Sir, What was Q doing with you?" Riker inquiered

"Well, he placed me in clothes of some kind of military leader from Earth's past...."

"I believe that was the clothes of the president of Cuba of the late 20th century, what a fun time that was in your short history!" the voice of Q rang out through the bridge. Picard looked around for any sign of Q but saw no sight of him. Picard then noticed that Data's command console was inactive.

"Commander, I thought I told you to run a scan for Q?" Picard asked. Data turned round and it wasn't Data sitting there, it was Q.

"Inquiry: Why am I following your orders?" said Q in Data's voice Picard looked cross "Where's Commander Data?" he demanded

"Oh don't worry about your little robot, I've put him back in the box for storage" Q joked. Picard was not impressed and hadn't noticed that Worf was moving menicingly towards Q.

"Really, Macro-head I thought you would have learned by now that your captain won't let you attack me despite it being in your archaic and primitive traditon to attack all that you don't understand" Q said smugly. Worf growled at Q and started to advance before Picard stopped him

"No, Worf theres no point in dealing with him that way" Picard said calmly. Worf backed down but was still harbouring anger at Q

"Oh really, Mon Capitan. This ship could really use some action around here! Why not let Macro-head have his fun?" Q said with a glint in his eye

What happens next?
1211211112122.title: Q invades the bridge

choices: Yes, but only if Picard does something for him.
12112111121221.content:
Q snapped his fingers.
There was a flash of light and soon, everyone on the bridge was gone!
"Bring them back!" said Picard.
And does Q bring them back?
12112111121221.title: Q makes the bridge staff disappear

choices: A hidden base on the surface
121121112.content:
"Hello Captain! You are coming with me!" states the Romulan officer cooly, pointing a disruptor at Picard.

Picard taps his communicator once more but still it is inoperative.

"Now now Captain, surely you did not think that Commander Tomalak would be so stupid as to let you call for help?" quipped the Romulan.

"You should know that your presence her violates your treaty with the Federation," insists Picard before being transported off to...
121121112.title: a Romulan Officer dematerializing

choices: They want him to do something for them.
1211211122.content: Why have the Romulans kidnapped Picard?
1211211122.title: A romulan warbird

choices: the ship is plumetting towards the planet below.
12112112.content:
In Main Engineering Picard goes over to where Geordi is standing, talking to a young lieutenant. He then waits patiently for Geordi to finish his discussion.

As the lieutenant walks off Geordi turns to Picard and asks, "What can I do for you Captain?"

"Mr. La Forge, I'd like you to help Data determine what happened to the Gular Science station."

"Understood Captain!" replies Geordi, going over to a readout, "I'll get on it as soon as I can!"

"Is there a problem Commander?" inquires Picard.

"That's what I'm trying to figure out Sir. Ever since we entered the system we've been getting strange readings from the Warp core," answers Geordi, pciking up a PADD and going over to a control panel.

"What do you mean strange readings?"

"Every once in a while the power output levels of the core drop significantly and then return to normal. This is coupled with a series of false alarms in relation to the stability of the antimatter containment fields."

"Is the ship in danger?" demands Picard, slightly worried.

"I can't tell for sure yet," states Geordi, passing the PADD to another engineer, "I'll keep you informed!"

All of a sudden the deck shook and alarms blared out all around.

Riker's voice came on the intercom saying, "Red Alert, Captain to the Bridge!"

Picard tugged at his uniform and went straight back into the turbolift.

"Deck One!" snaps Picard as the deck rocks again.

When Picard gets to the bridge he sees that...
12112112.title: Engineering Oddities

choices: Riker goes down to the surface
Picard wants to lead the away team
121122.content:
As Picard and Worf come onto the bridge the shimmering atmosphere of an Earth-like planet can be seen on the viewscreen.

"Report!" says Picard as he moves to Data's side, resting a hand on the chair back.

"Sensors detect no humanoid lifesigns," was Data's cool reply, "also no transporter signatures or weapons signatures have been detected."

"Reccomend sending down an away team sir!" suggests Commander Riker, coming to Picard's side.

"Affirmative!", replies Picard.

(does Picard send Riker down to the planet or does he try to go himself?)
121122.title: A Planetary Puzzle

choices: perhaps a torpedo will suit them better?
1211221.content:
"Number one, lead an away team to the surface. Try to find out what is going on!" ordered Picard.

"Worf, Data your with me!" announced Commander Riker as he walked up the ramp to the turbolift. Tapping his communicator he continued, "Geordi! Meet me in transporter room two!"

With that Riker, Worf and Data entered the turbolift. As the doors closed Picard sat down in his command chair trying to think about what could have happened to the Science station. As replacements for Data and Worf took their stations Picard had decided that he needed a quieter place to think.

"Sir!" exclaimed Ensign Beauchamp from Operations, "We are detecting a Ferengi vessel approaching from behind the planet's moon!"

"Blast," moaned Picard before ordering, "Hail them!"

"No response sir!"

"They're powering weapons!" announced Lieutenant Jefferies from tactical.

"Shields up!" ordered Picard. He gave his uniform a quick tug and stood up. Then, remembering the away team he tapped his communicator. "Picard to transporter room two. Has the away team left the ship yet?"

"I just finished the transport when the shields went up sir!" came the unwelcome reply.

Riker must have been in quite the hurry to have left so soon. Oh well, nothing to do about that now!

"Sir they're firing!" exclaimed Jefferies.

Picard turned to face the viewscreen as the Ferengi disruptor bolt tore across space towards the Enterprise. With a jolt the deck announced their arrival.

"Looks like the Ferengi don't want to talk," stated Picard glumly. Giving his uniform another tug he continued, "Return fire!"

Picard then watched as two of the Enterprise's phaser beams struck the Ferengi's shields. In return the Ferengi fired two disruptor blasts.

"Sir!" came Jefferies' voice, "...
1211221.title: A Sudden Attack

choices: Picard doesn't find anything of value
12112211.content:
This was not a good day. Picard watched in horror as a second Ferengi Marauder glided towards the Enterprise. The Ferengi now held the upper hand. Picard had no choice but to order retreat. When asked about the away team he could only reply that they'll have come back for them. Within moments the Enterprise leapt away from it's foes at Warp two.

Shortly after that Ensign Beauchamp announced, "The Ferengi ships are not pursuing!"

That could mean one of two things either they knew about the away team on the surface or there was something of value in the Gular system.

"Drop out of Warp!" ordered Picard once he was sure they were out of danger, "And bring up all the sensor data we recovered uupon entering the Gular system. Send it to the viewing station in my ready room." With that Picard strode into his ready room shouting out behind himself, "Lieutenant Jefferies, you have the bridge!"

Picard then sat at his desk and began reviewing the information.
12112211.title: A Retreat to Higher Ground

choices: Separate the ship and go back
121122111.content:
After nearly an hour of searching for something that may have interested the Ferengi Picard had found nothing of value. He was about to stop when he noticed that the amount of radiation originating from the innermost planet had been a little high. It was not enough of a fluctuation from the expected norm to catch someone's attention in anormal situation but this was not a normal situation.

Getting up for a cup of tea Picard contemplated the situation. Either he could return to the Gular system to find out why the Ferengi were there and to get back his away team or he could sit and wait for reinforcements that wouldn't be here for hours. The biggest problem with returning is that Picard couldn't bring himself to risk the lives of the families on the ship and would then have to perform a saucer separation. This would leave the stardrive section without the saucer's powerful impulse engines.
121122111.title: A Choice to Return

choices: "Very well, You head the team Commander!"
1211222.content:
"Commander Riker, You have the bridge!" announces Picard, "Worf, Data, your with me!"

Shocked at the turn of events Riker takes a second to react before replying, "Sir, may I remind you that it is unsafe for the Captain to go on an away team into a possibly dangerous situation!"

(Picard's reply)
1211222.title: Who leads the team?

12112221.content:
With Riker standing there in shock, Picard enters the Turbolift with Data and Worf.

"Transporter room one!" says Picard and the lift starts to move.

When the lift stops and the doors open Picard comes face to face with Counsellor Troi.

"Not now Counsellor!" he says and tries to pass her.

"Captain!" she replies, grabbing his arm, "We need to talk."

"About what?" inquires Picard as he resumes walking.

"Do you intend to go ahead and lead the away team?"

"What does it look like Counsellor?" retorts Picard.

"Well sir, I'm not sure that's the best idea!" she responds.

"If it'll make you happy you can come too Counselor, otherwise I can't help you."
12112221.title: On the way to the transporter

121122212.content:
"I'm sorry Captain but I have some appointments I just can't break. Just be careful down there!" stated Counsellor Troi.

"Always Counsellor," replied Picard as He, Worf and Data entered the transporter room.

"Lock coordinates for the location of the Science station," Data told the Transporter operator.

Stepping onto the transporter pad Picard looked around to see Worf and Data already in position.

"Energize!" said Picard just before dematerializing.

Seconds later Picard found himself in a corridor. Looking around he saw Data busy scanning the area whith his tricorder as Worf did a similar sweep with his phaser. Picard now had to choices. Either he could proceed down the corridor in front of him or he could go down the corridor behind him.
121122212.title: A beam down

choices: What's left of the station's crew
1211222121.content:
Walking forward down the corridoer Picard noticed how there seemed to be no damage to the corridor. There was abolutely no sign of any attack. It was like the crew of the station had just been transported away.

"No life signs Captain," stated Data, coming up to Picard's side.

Spotting a large doorway Picard started heading towards it. he motioned for Worf to open the door. When it opened Picard stood in shock. In the room beyond there was...
1211222121.title: The discovery

12112221211.content:
Picard walked into the room and looked around. He could count five bodies. None of them seemed to be alive.

"They apear to have been killed by disruptors," stated Data, scanning the room with his tricorder.

"That means that they were probably killed by Romulans, Klingons or Ferengi," replied Picard.

"The Cardassians could have also done this but it is highly unlikely one of their vessels would have managed to elude detection while en route here," returned Data.

Just then Worf's Tricorder started beeping. "Captain! I am picking up life signs heading this way!"
12112221211.title: A disaster

choices: Picard's away team and Tomalak are beamed to a Romulan ship
Worf, Data and Picard were rendered unconscious
121122212111.content:
Just then an entire contingent of Romulan troops entered the room.

"Hello Captain! We meet again!" says a familiar voice.

The guards parted to reveal the smiling face of Commander Tomalak.

"Tomalak!" snarls Worf, raising his phaser.

"Mr. Worf is it? I wouldn't suggest trying that!" says Tomalak calmly.

Worf fires his phaser and the beam bounces off a forcefield just inches from Tomalak's face. Unfortunately for Worf the beam returns the way it came and hit him square in the chest. As Data goes to Worf's aid Picard glres at Tomalak.

"Oh Captain! You must know that I won't let you get the upper hand quite so easily this time!" states Tomalak.

"What do you want?" demands Picard.

"For one, you are in no position to make demnds. And as to what I'm up to you'll see soon enough!" hisses Tomalak.

Tomalak then pulls out his communicator and mutters something into it. The next thing that happened was that...
121122212111.title: Tomalak's Arrival

choices: Picard refuses to give the order
1211222121111.content:
When the transporter sequence was complete Picard found himself standing in a Romulan Jail cell with Tomalak safely on the other side of the force field. Across the way Picard saw Worf and Data in their very own cells.

"What is going on?" demands Picard

"Captain! I have a proposal for you!" says Tomalak indifferently, "Either you order Riker to surrender the Enterprise to me or I'll kill Worf and terminate Data!"

"You wouldn't!" says Picard in shock.

"Oh, I think I would!" replies Tomalak, laughing, "You have two minutes to decide!"
1211222121111.title: In a Romulan Brig

12112221211112.content:
"Never Tomalak!" retorts Picard.

"Think about it Captain!" says Tomalak, smugly, "In the meantime I think that have my engineers start disecting Data! Let me know when you change your mind!"

With that Tomalak walks off. Picard then watches in horror as Data is transported off somewhere else. Worf bangs on the forcefield, shouting in rage, but to no avail. After a few moments Worf calms down.

"Captain! What are we to do?" asks Worf.

(Picard's reply)
12112221211112.title: Refusal and Data's Dissaperance

121122212111121.content:
After a few hours Tomalak returns holding what looks like Data's arm.

He puts it in Picard's cell and says, "Here, something for you to remember Data by!"

When Tomalak is gone again Worf lets out a loud cry of mourning for Data. Picard stops him as he pulls out the fake insides of the arm Tomalak gave him.

"You mean that Data might still be alive?" asks Worf, worried for his android friend.

"Yes, I think that's very likely!" replies Picard.

After another hour of waiting Tomalak returns and...
121122212111121.title: Waiting Silently

choices: He give Tomalak what he wants
1211222121111212.content:
Worf is then tied to a chair and some Romulans walk in with a collection of tribbles, feathers and Klingon Painsticks. The tribbles are then strapped to Worf as their shrill shrieks echo around the room. One of the romulans then starts to irritate Worf with the fethers while the other repeated ly shocks Worf with the painsticks. Worfs cries of agony are too much for Picard.

"Tomalak! Stop this madness!" demands Picard.

"Will you do as I say? Will you turn the Enterprise over to me?" inquires Tomalak.

Picard takes one look at Worf's face. He is uncertain how to continue.
1211222121111212.title: Worf's torture

choices: goes to question one of the Klingons
1211222121121.content: Without warning a group of Klingons run into the room, batleths at the ready. They try to attack the away team but Worf and Data cut them down with their phasers. When the dust cleared Picard...
1211222121121.title: Klingons

choices: "I have reason to believe that the Klingons have invaded the Gular system!"
"I just received word from Earth that my son may be on his deathbed!"
1212.content:
Normally, Picard would be concerned enough to ask what seems to be bothering Worf, but with a distress call in the waiting, Worf will just have to hold in what's bothering him a little bit longer.

"What's the status of that distress call?" Picard asks as he strides down the ramp and takes his seat in the captain's chair.

Without turning to him, Riker answers, "We've been having trouble getting the call to come through clearly, but we've almost got it cleared up."

Not two seconds later a crackly voice sounds over the bridge, as if coming from far away. "Attack on... defenseless outpost... thirteen scientists... soon or we won't make it... please HELP!--" The voice cut out as quickly as it had started.

"That's all we've been able to get, sir." says Riker. "What do you want to do?"

Captain Picard pursed his lips for a moment then said decisively, "Set a course for the source of the distress call. Warp eight. It sounded like they need immediate assistance. Let's find out what's going on."

As the helm officer laid in the coordinates, Picard finally turned to a practically fuming Lt. Worf. "Yes, Mr. Worf. Is there something you needed to talk to me about?"

Worf's deep bass repied seriously, "Yes, sir. You need to know..."
1212.title: He let's Worf simmer and walks down the ramp

choices: Go with Worf to negotiate with the Klingons.
Stay with Crusher and the injured scientists, one gives them information.
12121.content:
"You see, they have had a feud with Dr Charles Woodley, who is the head of the science department, and that's probably why they are attacking them."
"Well, just because they are the same species as you, doesn't mean they are at fault, Mr Worf," said Picard. "Now let's go save some scientists. Number One, when we arrive, you will have the bridge. Worf will come with me to negotiate with the Klingons if that's who attacked the Gular system. Dr Crusher will also accompany us if anyone is sick or hurt, and Geordi will come to do repair work on any broken machinery."
When they got to the planet, the thirteen scientists were alive, but injured. Dr Crusher began to treat them, while Geordi began to fix the machinery.
What does Picard do now?
12121.title: "I have reason to believe that the Klingons...

123.content:
One day, Troi was in her office.
She tried to organise her notes, but she kept getting distracted.
Like, she'd be thinking about Ensign Marx's progress and then suddenly want to go ice skating on the Holodeck.
Just then her communicator beeped. "Picard to Troi. Meet me in my ready room immediately."
Deanna Troi rushed to Picard's ready room, where a serious meeting was taking place.
"A Romulan warbird has hailed us. They say they want us to do something for them and they will reward us beyond our wildest dreams."
"Captain." said Troi. "I sense deception on behalf of the Romulans.
What does Troi do now?
123.title: Counsellor Troi

124.content:
Worf?
Doctor Crusher or Wesley?
Geordi?
124.title: more TNG choices

choices: With no one of importance in the transporter room and Wesley a no show Bill was
12422.content:
Wesley thinking.....".How can I tell my mother I took second overall? Picard will think I am lower than a Kwalltec from the planet Insinceres! My dead father will be continually surrounding the Sun, never to break free from the gravitational force holding him into death! Woe is me!"
"Ready to beam to the Enterprise, Wesley"? The chief engineer asked of him. It still is a phenomena that our bioelectronic configuration can be disassembled and reassembled from one point or location to another. Many people fear it and it's discomfiture. Many refuse. Some, to the point that they will not travel in space.
This particular phobia has been compared to the popular notion that ruined huge pharmaciticals back in the early 2000's. The reaction of the public to adverse reactions verses the likelihood of good from a symptom orientated society- take this pill-for this! Motivated people and science back into emphasizing treating and curing the cause which has led to the total disappearence of the common cold, headaches and returning from war syndrome.
Wesley knew of people that went missing during normal body transfers from ship to shore, ship to ship, and ship to explore. It always happened to someone else or at the last second a brilliant mathematician or Data/Spock/Scotty type, even a Wesley
saved the day by a long forgotten or extremely imaginitive, very creative and innovative mathematical configuration bringing the lost in cyberspace pieces all back together in the transfer room. For Wesley to say," Ready for transfer", was as common as his mother not allowing him to go on away missions! A given!
We never know when our last words will be spoken or what they might be but those were Wesleys! He simply did not arrive. He wasn't there to save himself. Either was anyone else.
12422.title: Wesley is just back from Academy taking second

choices: An alien had just beamed into Engineering.
A piece of equipment had blown up.
A piece of equipment had disappeared.
1243.content:
One day, Geordi was mucking around in Engineering.
He was trying to fix a replicator as well as dancing, wondering if he was a good dancer.
Then, something crazy happened. What was that crazy thing?
1243.title: Geordi

125.content: Data was calmly overlooking the bridge from the command chair. It was the night shift and all was quiet. Allthough the lack of events meant that he could review his memory banks in peace he felt that his positronic circuits "missed" the prescence of the rest of the command crew. All that was about to change when all of a sudden...
125.title: night shift

choices: Commander Tomalak of the Romulan Empire
1251.content:
Data's vision was blurring. He was also hearing a low hum. Standing up to inquire as to what was going on he blacked out.

When he came to Data was lying on a bare, curved steel floor. He sat up and looked around. There did not appear to be any kind of exit from the room. he then noticed that the room was a perfect sphere, providing no weaker points. Just then Data heard a voice.

"Welcome aboard my ship! My superiors will be very glad I managed to capture you!" announced the voice.

"Who are you? What do you want with me?" asked Data.

"What I want you for will be quite clear in a moment. As to who I am well, Lieutenant-Commander, I am...
1251.title: captured

12511.content:
"Commander Tomalak. Surely you realize that you have just committed an act of war against the Federation,” announced Data.
“Really Data, can I call you Data? No matter, you must think I am quite daft to not realize that I have left significant proof that it was a Ferengi vessel who took you away from the bridge of the Enterprise. They’ll be chasing that lead for a very long time! In the meantime we’ll have you all to ourselves,” replied Tomalak proudly, “In the meantime I believe it is time to end the charade.”
With that the metal sphere dissapeared revealing an advanced Romulan laboratory. Off to one side Data clearly saw Tomalak grinning from ear to pointed ear.
“I presume that that was some sort holographic projection?” inquired Data.
“You presume correctly, now if you’ll just hold still for a second my assistant here would like to take a sample of your circuitry.”
Data was about to reply when he noticed two huge metal cuffs forming around his hands and restricting their movement completely. His ankles were attached to similar cuffs.
“Ah yes, the restraints,” sighed Tomalak as another Romulan walked up to Data to remove one of his access panels, “It took a fair bit of work but we managed to simulate perfectly five ton iron cuffs with only a fraction of the size. I hope you do not mind.”
The other Romulan then tore away a small piece of circuitry. To compensate Data simply rerouted signals around the breach.
“Now for our next test I’d like you to perform a demonstration of your strength. This will be done by your holding an ever increasing amount of weight until you can no longer. At that point we will release pressure,” stated Tomalak, still grinning wildly.
12511.title: Tomalak's Tests

125112.content:
"Im afraid I must refuse" replied Data. The captain unpeturbed beckoned to one of two guards standing by the door. "Bring her" the guard left the room and came back minutes later with another guard dragging a struggling Belvery Crusher. Data stared emotionless as the guard brought a phaser to her neck.
"Assist me or the doctor dies" he hissed between his teeth. "Im afraid I can not cooperate". "This is a holodeck Belvery Crusher is not really there and" he added "either are you". The image of the Doctor disappeared and the guards followed suit disappearing. Everything faded then blurred and appeared the inner working of a ....
125112.title: Illusions

1252.content: Why did the alarm go off?
1252.title: alarm

131.content: Benjamin Sisko or his son Jake Sisko?
131.title: Sisko

133.content:
Major Kira Nerys woke up to find the station trying to shake itself apart around her. The alert klaxons were blaring so loudly that the Bajoran could barely hear herself think. She climbed quickly out of bed and took a moment to steady herself on the unstable deckplate. "Lights," she commanded.

"Kira to Ops," she shouted, pulling her Bajoran Militia uniform on.

"Ops here," she recognized Chief Obrien's Irish accent.

"What's going on Chief?" she asked, fully dressed and heading for the door. She was reasonably sure she knew the answer.

When he responded, she wasn't surprised, "Three Jehm' Hdar ships just came through the wormhole Major. They just started attacking." She could hear the chaos going on around him over the comm channel.

"I'm on my way Chief," she said, making her way through the habitat ring. Of course they'd attack while Captain Sisko was away with the Defiant. Unfortunately that meant Jadzia and Worf were gone too.

She finally made it to the lift, and braced herself for her arrival in Ops.

"Report'" she shouter, striding across the shifting deck.

"Three attack cruisers," the Chief reported, "They came through three minutes ago. Our shields are holding, but that won't be the case much longer," as if to emphasise his point, the station started to shake again.

At that point...
133.title: Rude Awakening

1331.content:
Just then, the attack suddenly stopped.
Do the Jem Hadar hail DS9?
1331.title: The attack suddenly stops...

1332.content:
"Major, another ship is decloaking." She looked over her shoulder and saw Commander Eddington at the tactical station. Maybe it was based on Odo's reactions, but she had never really taken to the Starfleet Security officer. Now she was glad he was here. "Major, its the Defiant!" There was a short pause and Kira silently thanked the Prophets. "Captain Sisko is hailing us."

"On screen Commander," she said, trying to maintain her composure as the station rocked around her. Before long, Captain Benjamin Sisko's face was looking at her, carrying a solemn expression.

"It looks like we got back just in time," he said.

"Couldn't agree more Captain." Kira started to get him up to speed,"Three Dominion ships came through the wormhole and started attacking us."

"Sir," she heard Jadzia's voice in the background, "They're retreating."

Kira looked to Eddington for confirmation, and he simply nodded his agreement. Just like that it was over. She put aside her confusion, for the moment, simply happy that the room had stopped shaking.

"Well, that was easy," Sisko said.

She shrugged and the communication ended. "Damage Chief?"

"Its all superficial..." He paused, and the tone of his voice told her something wasn't sitting right.

"Something wrong Chief?"

"I don't know Major. The attack only lasted a few minutes, but the Jehm H'dar know what they're doing. They could have hurt us if..."

"If?"

"If they'd been trying sir."

That opened a brand new can of worms. Unfortunately she didn't have time to worry about it just now. When the Captain came aboard he was going to want to know what kind of shape they were in.

"Kira to Infirmary."

"Bashir here," she heard Julian's voice. At least he didn't sound to stressed. That was a good sign.

"Casualties Doctor?"

"Nothing serious Major. Mostly bruises and cuts from being tossed around."

"Glad to hear it Doctor," she said, already on the lift. She wanted to be at the airlock when Sisko came aboard.
1332.title: Reinforcements

13321.content:
Kira went over to the airlock and the Defiant docked.

Sisko, Dax, Eddington and Worf came out.

"Welcome back," said Kira.

"It's nice to see you," said Dax.

"It's nice to see you too," said Kira, "but this is serious. The Dominion ships attacked us, then left. All damage is superficial, but O'Brien said that they would have hurt us if they'd be trying to. Now, the question is, why would the Jem'Hadar attack us without the intent to hurt us?"

Does anyone have a theory on why the Jem'Hadar would do that?
13321.title: Go straight to the airlock...

choices: "Sorry, but I'm afraid I'm too busy."
13322.content:
Kira got out of the lift and started making her way along the hallway when she saw Odo.

"Hello, Major," said Odo, "Where are you going?"

"To the airlock," said Kira, "I want to see Sisko and tell him what O'Brien said about the attack. Would you like to come too?"

What does Odo say?
13322.title: Meet Odo along the way...

141.content:
In Voyager's ready room Captain Janeway was sat at her desk staring at the Starfleet Cadet's Manual on her laptop, this was as she had just passed Icheb in his third Starfleet Academy test. The door bell chimed.


Who walked in you decide.
141.title: Captain Janeway

choices: Chakotay invites the Captain for dinner
1412.content:
"Come in" Janeway said in a tired tone.
Chakotay walked into the ready room and handed Janeway a padd.
Janeway examined it for a few seconds and looked up at Chakotay and smiled.
"I think this would be fine in order to pick the equipment up that we need, just report to Lieutenant Torress and let her know of your findings Commander." Janeway ordered.
"Aye Captain"
Janeway continued what she was doing before Chakotay had arried.
1412.title: Chakotay

14123.content: "Come in" Janeway spoke as she looked up and noticed Chakotay was still standing there.
14123.title: The Doorbell chimes again

choices: "Dad told me that it would be nice for me to visit my Godmother"
"I've come for a bit of fun"
141232.content:
"Hello, Aunt Kathy Surprise!" shouts Q2, A flash of light follows and Janeway's ready room is covered in balloons and streamers on the wall and flowers on the desk. Q2 also flashes up blowouts in his and Chakotay's mouth, Q2 blows his

"Well, It's nice to see you Q but what's all this for?" asked Janeway with surprise and curiosity
141232.title: It's always a party with Q2!

choices: Janeway's duplicate immideatley beams her to the mirror universe
1413.content:
"Come in" Captain Janeway said with a tired tone in her voice.
the door opened and in walked a second Captain Kathryn Janeway.
"Who the hell are you" the first Captain said.
"It's called the mirror universe dearie" the second one replied.
"How did you manage to get onto the bridge without people asking questions." the first Janeway asked curiosly.
"I just told them i was messing around with the transporter systems." Janeway two said with pride as if it was the best thing she had ever thought of or done.
1413.title: Janeway's Duplicate

choices: Take the other Janeway to Sickbay to scan her.

"Janeway to security!" said Janeway. "There's an intruder who who looks like me in my ready room."
Tuvok came up and discovered the second Janeway in the ready room.
He then put a force field around the room so the other Janeway couldn't escape.
What do Tuvok and Janeway do?

154.content:
One day, Dr Phlox was in sickbay, feeding his animals.
He had given his lizard a piece of steak, as he'd been trying to wean it off tribbles. He then gave some worms, to his bat and some more worms to his leeches.
Just then, the door beeped.
"Come in," he said, a bit distracted.

Then, somebody walked in. Who was it?
154.title: Dr. Phlox

He was asked to go there on behalf of someone else.

15432.title: She's pregnant.

choices: More crewmembers reported nightmares to Phlox.
154331.content:
"I have been having nightmares," said Hoshi.
"They happened over the past few days. First was a dream where Archer told everyone else to leave except me, then he stripped his uniform, turned into a werewolf and tried to eat me. The second was of Trip but it wasn't Trip it was this intimidating version of Trip, and the third was of Malcolm but he was treating me like a baby."

Phlox scanned Hoshi and she seemed alright, so he just sent her on her way, but then...
154331.title: She's been having nightmares.

info.brief_description: You are one of the star trek characters as you boldly go where no one has gone before

You pick a TV series and a character then go on to boldly go where no one has gone before.

Use good grammar

No intercourse

don't kill any main characters

keep it in the star trek universe

no perverted stories

try to follow just the 1 character

feel free to add on
